glsa.title: GnuTLS: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in GnuTLS, the worst of which could lead to arbitrary code execution.

background.p: GnuTLS is an Open Source implementation of the TLS 1.2 and SSL 3.0 protocols.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in GnuTLS. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

impact.p: A remote attacker could utilize multiple vectors to spoof arbitrary SSL servers via a crafted certificate, execute arbitrary code or cause a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All GnuTLS users should upgrade to the latest version:
